title: Idly
description: Feather-light steamed rice cakes, a South Indian classic that's both comforting and nourishing.
steps: Wash rice and urad dal separately and soak them in water for 4-6 hours.
Drain the water and grind them separately into a fine paste. Mix them together, add salt, and mix well.
Allow the batter to ferment overnight.
Grease idly molds, pour the batter into them, and steam for 10-12 minutes.
Serve your Idly with coconut chutney and sambar.

title: Dosa
description: Paper-thin, crispy crepes with endless possibilities for fillings, a canvas for culinary creativity.
steps: Wash rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds separately and soak them in water for 4-6 hours.
Drain the water and grind them together into a smooth batter. Add salt and mix well.
Allow the batter to ferment overnight.
Heat a dosa griddle, pour a ladle of batter, and spread it into a thin circle. Drizzle oil around the edges.
Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy. Serve your Dosa with chutney and sambar.

title: Rasam
description: A warm, zesty broth that wakes up your taste buds and soothes your soul with every sip.
ingredients: For tempering: 1 teaspoon ghee, 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds, a pinch of asafoetida, curry leaves
steps: Pressure cook toor dal until soft. Mash it and set aside.
In a pan, combine tomatoes, tamarind paste, rasam powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Add water and cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add the mashed toor dal and bring to a boil. Simmer for a few minutes.
Prepare the tempering by heating ghee in a small pan and adding mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Pour this over the rasam.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve your Rasam hot.

title: Palak Paneer
description: Creamy spinach and soft paneer cubes unite to create a vibrant, vegetarian masterpiece.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh spinach (palak), blanched and pureed
steps: Heat oil or ghee in a pan and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add finely chopped onion and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and the oil separates.
Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add pureed spinach and cook for a few minutes. Add milk or cream and cook until the mixture thickens.
Add cubed paneer and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve your Palak Paneer with rice or naan.

title: Chicken Kurma
description: A fragrant curry with tender chicken, a symphony of spices, and a touch of coconut richness.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté finely chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Add coconut paste, yogurt, and garam masala. Cook until the chicken is tender and the gravy thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve your Chicken Kurma with rice or naan.

title: Methi Paneer
description: Paneer cubes bathed in a luscious fenugreek-infused gravy, a North Indian favorite.
ingredients: 1 cup fresh methi leaves (fenugreek leaves), chopped
steps: Heat oil or ghee in a pan and sauté cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns translucent.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft and the oil separates.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped methi leaves and cook until they wilt.
Add cubed paneer and cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve your Methi Paneer with roti or paratha.

title: Chicken Dum Briyani
description: Layers of aromatic rice and succulent chicken, slow-cooked to perfection for a royal feast.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, soaked and drained
Fresh coriander leaves and fried onions for garnish
steps: Heat oil or ghee in a large heavy-bottomed pan. Sauté thinly sliced onions until golden brown. Remove half for garnish.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft.
Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Add yogurt, biryani masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the chicken is tender.
Layer soaked and drained basmati rice over the chicken mixture. Top with fried onions and fresh coriander leaves.
Cover with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes until the rice is cooked and aromatic. Serve your Chicken Dum Biryani hot.

title: Prawn Gravy
description: Plump prawns dancing in a rich, savory sauce, a seafood lover's delight.
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté finely chopped onion until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cleaned prawns and cook until they turn pink and opaque.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for a few minutes until the gravy thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve your Prawn Gravy with rice or naan.

title: Kesar Kulfi
description: Saffron-kissed creamy goodness, a frozen delight that transports you to India's streets.
ingredients: A pinch of saffron strands, soaked in warm milk
steps: In a heavy-bottomed pan, simmer milk until it reduces to half its quantity, stirring frequently.
Add condensed milk, milk powder, cardamom powder, and saffron-soaked milk. Mix well and simmer for a few more minutes.
Remove from heat and let it cool.
Pour the mixture into kulfi molds or popsicle molds.
Freeze for 6-8 hours or until set.
Garnish with chopped nuts before serving your Kesar Kulfi.

title: Samosa
description: Crispy, triangular parcels filled with spicy potatoes, a beloved snack with a crunchy twist.
steps: Prepare the dough by mixing all-purpose flour, salt, and oil. Knead into a smooth dough using water. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds and coriander seeds. Sauté until fragrant.
Add mashed potatoes, boiled peas, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook until the filling is dry.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into a circle. Cut in half to form semicircles.
Fold each semicircle into a cone shape and fill with the potato mixture. Seal the edges to form a triangular shape.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or pan and fry the samosas until golden brown and crispy. Serve your Samosas hot with chutney.

title: Muruku
description: Crunchy, spiraled snacks with a hint of spice, a South Indian delight for munching.
ingredients: 1/4 cup urad dal (split black gram) flour
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, urad dal flour, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, asafoetida, red chili powder, and salt.
Add melted butter and mix well. Add water gradually to form a smooth, non-sticky dough.
Fill a murukku maker with the dough and press out the dough through a star-shaped hole into hot oil.
Fry until murukku turns golden brown and crispy. Drain excess oil and cool.
Store your Murukku in an airtight container.

title: Pani Puri
description: Hollow crispy shells brimming with spicy, tangy water and delightful fillings, a beloved street food adventure.
steps: Prepare the puris by mixing semolina, all-purpose flour, and water to form a stiff dough. Roll into small balls and flatten into discs. Fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.
Prepare the filling by mixing boiled and mashed potatoes, boiled chickpeas, tamarind pulp, chaat masala, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Prepare the spicy water by blending tamarind pulp, mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chili, black salt, roasted cumin powder, and salt with water.
Make a hole in each puri and fill it with the potato-chickpea filling.
Dip the filled puris in the spicy water and serve your Pani Puri immediately.
